answers.answer: Have you had an EMG, an electrical conduction study, to check for peripheral neuropathy problems?  Diabetes can cause peripheral neuropathy.  You might get a referral to a neurologist if you are also feeling any numbness, tingling, or burning in your feet.Have you had your potassium checked lately to make sure it isn't on the low side?  Low potassium can cause weakness.You also might consider switching to pool exercise, where while you get exercise to your muscles, the weight aspect is totally different than outside the water.  Do you have a local Y with a heated pool?

question: My legs dont want to support me anymore.  They feel like dead weight with slight exersition.  Blood pressure to my legs have been tested and is ok.  I want to be as active as always but now only walk a mile a day. I am a 77 yr old male, diabetic with heart problems (pacemaker), vericose veins and buldging spine disc at mid section (at avg weight).  Docs dont know or wont say.  What could it be so that I can understand it?
title: Weak legs
